div.l: A theffe he was for soth of corn and mele
And that a sclyȝe vsing for to stele
His name was callid Denus Symkyn
A wyff he had com of nobill kyn
The ꝑperson of the town hirshishir fadir was
And with hir he gaff many a pound of bras
For that Symkyn shuld in his blood aly
She was fosterid in a Nonnery
For Symkyn wold no wyff as he seide
But she were nurtrid and a mayde
To save his estate of yemanry
And she was prowd ⁊and pert as a py
A ful feir siȝt was on hem too
Oppon he holy day to fore hir͗e wold he goo
With his typpet bound a bout his hede
And she cam afftir in a gyte of rede
And symkyn had hosyn of þe same
There durst no white cal hir͗e but dame
Was noon so hardy that went by the wey
With hir durst rage or onys pley
But yff he wold be scleyn of Symkyn
With pavade knyff or boydekyn
For Ielouse folk by perlous evir mo
Algatis they wold hir wyvis went so
And eke for she was som dele smotirlich
She was a deynouse as watir in a dich
As ful of hokur and bismare
Hir þouȝt a lady shuld not be hir͗e peer
What for hir͗e kynrede ⁊and for for hir͗e nurtry
That she had lernyd in the Nonry
A douȝt̉er had they be twene hem to
Of xx wyntir age with out mo
Saveing a child that was halff yeer of age
In cradill it lay it was a ꝓpropir page
This wench thik and growen was
With a calvis nose and eyen grey as glas
